taskfour: Task Four: Traffic Light Simulator III
taskfive: Task Five: Traffic Light Simulator IV
taskone_when_traffic: If traffic light turns from Green to Amber or in red when travelling to the Green Line,
taskone_no_press: If the traffic light remain Green when travelling to the Green Line, no need to press any key
taskone_system_automatically: System will scores you performance automatically
taskone_stop_closely: When the traffic light signal is red, if you can stop the car before the red line, it will be counted as a Successful stop. Otherwise it will be counted as a Failed stop
taskone_no_count: If the traffic light remain Green when you stop the car, it will be counted as a Failed stop. If you keep going, it will be counted as a Successful stop
taskone_will_be_counted: ) will be counted as a Successful stop
taskone_a_car_stopping: A car stopping more than 10m away from the stop line will be counted as a Failed stop
taskone_press_the_button: Press the button to brake the car.
tasktwo_use_the_rule: Use the rule parameters as shown below the simulation frame.
tasktwo_to_observe: to observe the performance of the designed rule
tasktwo_system_automatically: System automatically and continuously selects the relevant rule to apply and score the resulting performance
tasktwo_the_rules_only: The rules only works when there is an amber or red light. In other words

taskthree_input_your_choices: Input your choices of distances and speeds and the actions to take
taskthree_your_rules_reflect: Your rules reflect your driving style (Are you a conservative or aggressive driver)

taskthree_adjust_your_rule: Adjust your rule parameters to see the different performances
taskthree_click_screen_capture: Click screen capture to capture your perfect rule set
taskthree_click_change_weather: Click Change weather and repeat step 1 to step 4
taskthree_the_rules_only: The rules only works when there is an amber or red light. In other words
taskthree_the_red_rule: the red rule indicator will only light when the light is *not* green.
